conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a semi-circular glass brick and light incident at point P.
Semi-circle with center O and radius R, point P on the diameter, light incident vertically upwards.
Light incident vertically upwards and totally reflected on the circular surface.
Reflected ray inside the glass bends to emerge parallel to the incident light.

Denote point where light hits the circular surface as Q, light goes from P to Q, reflects, and exits at R.
Angle of incidence at Q equals angle of reflection.
Angle of refraction in air makes emerging ray parallel to incident ray.
Introduce coordinates with O at origin, P at (d, 0), and equation of circle x² + y² = R².
Direction vector from P to Q is (x - d, y), normal vector at Q is (x, y).
Angle of incidence α is between direction vector and normal vector using dot product.
Consider symmetry in reflection and refraction for emerging ray to be parallel.
